Description: Lower body fragment of East Greek pottery bowl. Inside glazed with red band lined in white; outside, wild goat leaping to right, head probably turned back - its belly and the tip of its beard and muzzle preserved; in the field a dot rosette and an outline rosette; below the frieze, a black band and traces of a lower zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'The added white and red on the bands separating the friezes are common in Late Wild Goat' - implying that the band here has such additions.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 12, no. 37 pl. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.885)
